website_summaries.verdict: If you regularly have a lot of coins to sort and count, this coin counter has all the features for the count. Fully automated with multiple settings, this machine makes sorting a lot of change quick and easy.
pros: Hopper holds 2,000 coins while the bin holds 900 coins
Sorts all U.S. coins and can accommodate coin wrappers
The machine features 3 different modes – counting mode, adding mode and batching mode, which is where the machine sounds an alert and stops when it reaches a certain amount
cons: The machine itself is fairly large and heavy
Also keep in mind it does not come with coin wrappers

customer_reviews.title: Kids even love it
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about spending this much for a machine that we won’t use that often but we have a TON of change to wrap and it would take days to do it. It’s super easy to use and the kids have been doing it with no issues. If 7 and 8 year olds can do it you can too!
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: Does not correctly count money consistently.
customer_reviews.text: Machine is easy to use and most of the time, the count is correct. However, when it sometimes does not count the coin correctly, you are not able to trust that it ever counts the coin correctly. Since we were using it to double-count coin we had already counted, we were able to know when it was off. We ordered a replacement, just in case the first one was a lemon, but have returned the second one too.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie O.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic machine, just let it cool down every now and then.
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased this C200 to sort a bunch of coins I had been tossing into a 5 gal jug for the last few years, I would run it for a while then let it cool off. So far my only complaint about this is that the bin that collects the pennies is not big enough, I had to stop the machine and dump out the penny bin before resuming my sorting. Even though the sorting process seems slow, it only took a couple of hours or so to sort the whole 5 gallon jug. I have not used the coin rolling function, so I don't have a review of that as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Danny B.

customer_reviews.title: Read or you will get frustrated!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Dont put rolling paper into coin roller slot wait till they stop when quantity is reached. Remove from slot put paper into top upside down slides perfectly over coins. Turn upsdide down coins fall right in fasten ends. Coins do jam sometimes but i empty back into tray and let it try again. 9 out of 10 times it gets it right the 2nd time. This is a amazing machine to roll a bunch of old change i had sitting around.
customer_reviews.author: Your Kidding Me

customer_reviews.title: Clogs and jams with only a few coins
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this coin counter but it is absolutely horrible! Awkward and cumbersome. Not easy to use. I put in only a handful of coins and they all jammed. The unit is heavy so turning it upside down to shake out a few coins was not easy at all. I do not recommend this coin counter for home use at all. Returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how this got such great reviews. Stopped working the same day. Roll option is a joke as the coins would overflow since they couldn't slide down properly. Coins also somehow got stuck inside the part of machine I couldn't get to so I had to flip and shake them out.
customer_reviews.author: CM H.

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This made our days of sorting coins so much easier! We used to hand sort/count but then it got too overwhelming. Its a tad confusing to figure out initially...but once you get the hang of it, its pretty easy. We did have to keep an eye on it though because sometimes the coins drop angled into the holder and it all ends up spilling out. I highly recommend buying the pre-formed wrappers and make sure they are not dented! Or...sort/count without the wrapper first and then manually add into wrapper. I think out of $400ish dollars worth of coins that we sorted and turned into the bank...the teller said we were only off by under $3. Sounds great to me!

customer_reviews.title: Cassidia was a whimp!
customer_reviews.text: I really had high hopes for this machine. The price was steep but it would have paid for itself if it had cut our money counting time in half, as predicted. It did not count bills accurately, placed 8 extra pennies in each sleeve, clogged easily 9every use!). This meant we had to count after the machine! We cleaned it and it worked once accurately, so if the secret is to clean after each use, you can have this machine! We should get a full refund! I’ll hunt a better machine next year.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on over $600 USD of accumulated coins
customer_reviews.text: Recently I have been seeing signs in businesses asking customers to cash in their rolled coins. I knew I had a lot of coins laying around and was not about to sort and count them manually, so I bought this machine. Although the manual could be better, it is adequate and I quickly learned that it does exactly what I needed it to do. It took maybe a few hours of intermittent effort, but I easily sorted and rolled over $600 in change that I had accumulated. For the price, it is a good buy. I will probably sell it and vow to never accumulate that much change again, but I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: Great until it failed at 76 days of light use.
customer_reviews.text: I was bragging and taking credit for such a great idea to add this machine to our small store. It was used once a day to count about $12-15 in each of two drawers. Day number 76 we noticed it started mixing coins and giving incorrect totals every time used. If you need a coin counter for only 2 months of light use, ok, but otherwise invest in more machine because this one turned out to be too good to be true. Can't be used with any accuracy and remixes the coins in the sorting bins.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Leach

customer_reviews.title: I've owned coin sorters before, but this is the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I have had 5 coin sorters in the past, but this Cassida C200 is the BEST OF THE BUNCH. It is quieter, faster, and more accurate. The bins are large enough for end of day use, and, when using the coin roll tubes, the unit does NOT throw the coins over the tube like other makes! If you need to count a large number of coins at ANY time of the day, between shift or EOD, this is the unit for you. Harry Scott Buehlmeier President Scott Gordon Enterprises, Inc.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Buehlmeier

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little, SAVE a lot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Cassida c200 almost 6 years ago to the day. This is of my favorite purchases. I use it several times a year, bring it to my kids’ school for fundraisers and even loan it to friends (for a small fee); we all have those few friends that want to use what you have, but won’t buy it for themselves. I take care of it and have never had an issue. I’ve even encouraged a few friends in the restaurant business to keep one in their office. If it wasn’t as good as it is I’d probably have lost close to $1,000 by forgoing the spare change jars I use. Two words of advice : BUY ONE
customer_reviews.author: TheBallHawk

customer_reviews.title: 100% Accurate Every Time
customer_reviews.text: This coin counter is not cheap. But if you want a counter that is 100% accurate every time and easy to use, this is the one you want. Accuracy was a concern when I was shopping for a coin counter and many reviewers were disappointed by some of the other counters out there. This one got good reviews for its accuracy and after my purchase I can verify that it is accurate every single time. I could not be happier with my purchase of this counter.
customer_reviews.author: Astro

customer_reviews.title: Not great if you have to use daily
customer_reviews.text: We were super excited to purchase this coin sorter as I have been acting as the manual coin sorter daily for 20 years. This is not the machine you want to purchase if you have a business with hundreds of coins to sort on a daily basis. The machine gets clogged quiet frequently. We cleaned it religiously; it is in excellent condition. However, it's not meant for daily use (with the quantity of coins we filter through it). Looks great and it's not loud, just does not meet our needs.
customer_reviews.author: starlight designs

customer_reviews.title: Does not work properly
customer_reviews.text: This machine does not work very good. It is always getting jammed up and when I set it to count 40 quarters, it will stop at 40 but when counting them myself there will be a few more, only sometimes will it be the right amount of 40. I can get my coins rolled a lot faster counting them myself and putting into the paper form manually. Maybe I just got a junk one??? This was a waste of $200. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: melanie d whaley

customer_reviews.title: Tired of Paying 10 Percent
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of paying ten percent at the local grocery store (and my local Wells Fargo got rid of their coin counting machine), so I bought this. Very easy to operate. Buy the pre-rolled coin wrappers. Counts are absolutely accurate so far. Don't reprogram the default counts (I couldn't initially find the instructions). Read the instructions and it I think it will do exactly what a "residential consumer" would want. It's funny in that now my wife and I don't leave any change coin change behind at stores, we bring it home and put it in the machine.
customer_reviews.author: James F.

customer_reviews.title: I have  two of these. They jam most everytime you use them.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. They jam most everytime you use them. Sensors are bad on all denominations so now we just use it to sort. I under no circumstance would order them again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Jones

customer_reviews.title: On the expensive side - but works well.
customer_reviews.text: This was kind of expensive, but it worked really well. I found it best to sort the change first & then put it into rolls. Wish it came with more change wrappers. Unfortunately, after sorting/wrapping hundreds of dollars of change, we found out our bank just recently stopped charging a fee to use their commercial grade sorter because there is currently a coin shortage. So, when we brought in the pre-wrapped change, the bank made us unwrap them all & use their machine sorter!!!! 😤
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Palmer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. I bought it for my father for Christmas ...
customer_reviews.text: I rarely leave reviews but I took an exception for this beauty. This thing is awesome. I bought it for my father for Christmas since he had 2 giant water bottles filled with coins. It took me about 4.5 hrs for this things to sort 1 bottle (in coin wrapper mode), which was over $2K in coins. They only issue I had was more of a user error.....My father travels a lot so he had some foreign currency mixed in. A few of the foreign coins made it in the nickel sleeves but besides that....love it! I used it with the Royal Sovereign Coin Wrappers and had no issues. Should of bought more wrappers though.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon McDonald

customer_reviews.title: I think I got a lemon...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this machine for over a week and have had the worst trouble with it. I filmed it taking a minute and a half to just count and roll 1 roll of quarters. There was nothing else in the machine. ONE ROLL of quarters. This does not jibe with everybody else's experiences.
customer_reviews.author: Real Human Being

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The coin counter did not work well for me. It jammed 3 times during the first use. I put the coins in sparingly; only a handful of coins at a time. When I put a 2nd handful in before the previous load was empty, it started to get stuck. I spent about 15 minutes trying to get 1 coin at a time through. Eventually, I retrieved the remaining coins from the bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A real work horse, a great value. Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this machine for three years. We have processed thousands of coins with absolutely no problems. It is easy to use, just pour the coins in the hopper, put in the collection bins or the tube rollers and press start. We just recently processed 15,000 pennies and 3,200 dimes over a two week period and the machine was flawless. It has worked so well I bought one for my brother. The only issue I did have was that I misplaced two of the roller tubes. I contacted Cassida and they sent me replacements at no charge. Great customer service, even in the pandemic. Thank you Cassida.
customer_reviews.author: Bernese4Me

customer_reviews.title: A good gift
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this as a gift for my husband. He loves collecting coins. Everywhere we go his always looking for coins. If the cashier at the store gives me change his always asked me to hand it to him so he can looked at the change to see if there is older coins. Long story short over the years of collecting his got jars full of coins. And so i thought this would be a good gift for him so he can put them into one rolls and finally count them all too at the same time. Its actually kind of cool to see it counting the coins and rolling them. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Maricel L.

customer_reviews.title: Coin sorter and counter
customer_reviews.text: What a awesome machine, works beautifully, wish I went I had this years ago. Caution! Follow directions. Do not have a overzealous person Chuck in handfuls of coins then turn it on. It does not work that way. Turn the machine on, set it up for counting your different roles, then start placing coins in the hopper. Only one drawback is that sometimes dines fallout of the holder for dimes when they dropped into the container. But other than that I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: M. ROSENSTEEL

customer_reviews.title: Handy, but it wasn't long lived.
customer_reviews.text: This coin counter is okay. It was generally accurate after wrapping about $1000 in various coins. I had a handful that were off by one or two coins. The part that I didn't like was the internal feeder wheel (sorry don't know the technical term) broke after about $250. The unit still works, however I have to force coins down the slot to get it into the sorting chamber since the motor on the feeder gave out.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Does not count accurately
customer_reviews.text: Worked great the first time using it. The second time noticed was overfilling the tubes with coins. Checked the batch counts to make sure nothing had been changed and it hadn't. On third go around was over and undercounting coins. Cleaned all the sensors per instructions. Counted correctly the first round of tubes then began counting incorrectly again a majority of the time. Sending the item back because it is an overpriced sorter at this point. Too bad I was really hoping this product was going to work for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dena

customer_reviews.title: No Jamming
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this machine daily since it's arrival and it is just a work horse. So far we have only had a couple jams and those caused by a half dollars. Although it has a slot for half dollars our experience is that it doesn't like them at all. We have stopped putting them in and no jams or problems since. We get very few half dollars so it's not an issue for us. I am using it in my grocery store and we have a lot of lose change to count and this machine is sufficient for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kamala

customer_reviews.title: Great machine when it does its job ... however, that is not always.
customer_reviews.text: If you only want to sort change this is your machine. IF you want to roll coins accurately you still have to watch this machine very closely. Way too many times it is way under or way over the exact amount, even though the settings are set for the exact amount.
customer_reviews.author: SkyTop

customer_reviews.title: This machine saves you so much time and pays for itself!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this machine due to Covid closing our banks and coin counter machines. I was very skeptical at first even purchasing a machine like this. Pretty pricey but let me tell you it was the best investment ever! Wraps coins pretty quickly but only if you have quality wrappers. Take the ones they include and do yourself a favor...throw them away! I bought a pack of 512 wrappers on Amazon and they are high quality. Highly recommend this machine. You won't be disappointed! Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Heintzelman

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: Sorted then rolled $2500 mixed coins in less than 2 days without a problem this was a great investment well worth the money. I used both pre-formed and flat coin wrappers even though they say you shoudnt use flat wrappers, but with a little practice the flat coin wrappers work just fine. They did with me!! and cost less. Better to roll at home than take your coins to a store coin counter that takes 10-15 % especially large amount of coin. Great machine, two thumbs way up!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kyburz

customer_reviews.title: workhorse - totally recommend for a business
customer_reviews.text: we have had one of these for years at our store and when we opened a new store it was one of the first things i purchased. Best thing ever was better than the sort into a roll versions that work for a few months and constantly clog. this thing is a workhorse. Why have staff waste time counting coins - do yourself a favor get one of these. update still going strong
customer_reviews.author: Luvmyhusb

customer_reviews.title: Broken All Around
customer_reviews.text: THe product did not work out of the box. I called their support and they were outright rude saying they could not understand my accent and giggled on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Padma Venkatrangan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, so much faster than hand counting.
customer_reviews.text: We have a small non-profit, HEART for the Nations which is raising funds for a water filter factory in Haiti. Our project, "Change for Haiti" generates lots of coins by giving a group (we often do youth groups, Sunday School, Middle School) a free bottle of water. Then we ask them to put coins laying around in the bottle and return it. This makes counting a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: JW amazon user

customer_reviews.title: Nice Coin Counter, Sorter, and Roller
customer_reviews.text: First, the Cassida C200 Coin Sorter, Counter, and Roller (called the C200 in subsequent mentioned) came in great shape. Second, the C200 works very smoothly. I tested it out with a bank full of coins. Third, the greatest feature of the C200 is that the coins can all be sorted prior to placing them into rolls (via the use of the bins included). It makes getting the proper amount of coins into each roll very easy. I am very satisfied with the C200 and recommend this device to those who want to sort and roll coins in the simplest and most timely manner possible.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Steward

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Yes it's expensive compared to some competitors, but it never jams. It never gives you any problems. It just counts your coins without any headaches. What's that worth to you? You get what you pay for. The only issue I have is it stops each time once the coin wrapper is full so you can insert a new one. That happens often because this thing is fast. I wish it could autofeed new rolls. And speaking of coin rolls, only use performed ones. If you don't, you're gonna regret it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for work. It’s slow seems a little light duty for our needs time will tell. 12/4/2018 update we have been using this for 1 year and yesterday it quit working. I'm looking into the warrant period. Update 12/6/2018 it Has a one year warranty, just expired I guess I’m out of luck.😩
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: The Cassida C200 Works Exactly as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: The Cassida C200 worked perfectly right out of the box for me. It performed flawlessly both with counting mixed change and also with sorting change into preformed coin wrappers. Although expensive for my personal needs, it immediately became well worth the extra investment. I had no problem with following the printed directions, with reliability (it never jammed), or with consistency (it delivered the right amount every time into the coin wrappers - I checked before trusting it). Given the price point for me, I needed to be impressed and I was. I have only had it for a relatively short time, so I have no opinion on its long term performance...will advise if my opinion changes.
customer_reviews.author: Railgee

customer_reviews.title: This machine does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Well I gave it a workout today and it was accurate, I ran the coins 3 times..perfect it sorted the coins,and the preformed wrappers filled flawlessly.It was alot of fun as well..a little pricey but worth it.you will need to purchase more wrappers I ran through the included ones very quickly..
customer_reviews.author: Robert F.

customer_reviews.title: Good Coin Sorter
customer_reviews.text: Bought C-300 for my small business to count and sort coins. I did a little bit of a research and check other brands before choosing one. Some of the reviews talk mostly about jamming and inconvenience with coin bins sliding back in. I chose this machine because of its design and “quickload” technology that was advertised on their listing and video. When coin sorter was delivered, I feed in coins and started using it right away it jammed only once because of a Mexican coin that got into the hopper. So far have no problem, sorting and wrapping coins became a fun now. Definitely money well-spent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: After trying 2 other products from a different company, this one works great. Easy to use, I've just started and I've counted close to a thousand dollars in change and its worked flawlessly. Don't waste your money on a cheaper model, not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jett

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I immediately used the coin sorter when it arrived. It did a good job sorting coins and placing them in the coin tubes. So far, the coin sorter looks like a good deal. I will update my review when I use it over the next few months.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard L. Broseker

customer_reviews.title: good enough product
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd one. I average $3000-$4000 in coins a week. It works great for how I use it. The pennies and dimes often fall in the wrong slot so I always count pennies separate. I get frustrated because my machine tends to get jammed. When I go in to fish out the stuck coin the fuse will blow. The fuse required for this machine is not easily found in stores near me. I’ve had to send the machine back twice for repairs. And now I just had to buy my 3rd one because the mother board fried.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Cassida C200 Coin Counter
customer_reviews.text: Best Coin Counter ever I had, excellent quality, heavy duty, reliable,easy-to-use made forever Extremely easy to set-up. Excellent packaging and protection. VERY HAPPY with this Coin counter Very pricey But the Perfection has its price I would definitely recommend to a friend without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Laczko Studio

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for con box donation processing
customer_reviews.text: This coin counter worked quite well. I used it to roll coins from Civitan candy box donations. Because it keeps a running total of coins counted, it was easy to tally how much money came from each volunteers' boxes. If you use pre-formed tubes, it doesn't foul up very often. It will occasionally get fooled by a foreign coin. Good manual.
customer_reviews.author: LastGas

customer_reviews.title: Best coun counter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coin counter because I save my coins after breaking a dollar and overtime the coins add up and it becomes too much to count. The coin counter is so easy to use and it made life easier by counting and packing the in each individual wrap for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Lake

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast!!
customer_reviews.text: Holly crap this thing works well. The biggest thing I like is that it’s pretty quite. It’s also very well-made. We’ve enjoyed using it to roll change. Looking forward to taking a large load of loot to the bank. The only negative is it can be a little complicated to use the control panel but once you get the hang of it it’s pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: Pcrecycler_net

customer_reviews.title: The real Pro.
customer_reviews.text: Cassida C-300 is a uniqe piece of equipment, I have a lot of fun working with. I counted all coins I have at home before bringing it to work. And need to admit very important thing, that so far it did’t jam or miscounted even once. C-300 is easy to use in both, simply counting or sorting for rolling. I like that machine comes with coin wrappers they really help you to practice in wrapping if you have never done it.
customer_reviews.author: Shifokor

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Gave a quick look at the instructions, and turned it on and started counting coins worked flawlessly. Decided to try the Coin Wrap tubes which worked great, Make sure you put them in like they are suppose to go if you get them off it will be missal lined and some coins will miss the tube holder. I highly recommend this for someone dealing with a lot coins they need to count and / or wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hasselmeier

customer_reviews.title: Good machine.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. And accurate so far. The only down faults I can see is if the coin gets stuck side ways in coin roll the machine keep going and over fills the coin tube and could cause possible problem. Wish there was more distance in coin tube to see if there was a problem with coins. Plus protect the machine from possible jam up. Other then that I think it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Soso
customer_reviews.text: The .50 cent coins with jam in the machine but all others coins is fine
customer_reviews.author: gstyles

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: It counted and rolled about 900$ worth of mixed change in 2 hours. It jammed two times but that is because I threw in a lot of coins in at once. The machine is accurate right out of the box, no need to adjust anything. I recommend you use the Royal Sovereign pre-formed wrappers which makes things quick and easy. I would recommend this product to a friend. If the machines lasts and doesn't breakdown, I would consider it a good investment. No more coin-star fees or lugging big jugs of change to the bank. Roll-um and save them or deposit them into your bank account. The Cassida Coin Sorter makes it easy.
customer_reviews.author: dec0der

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine Cassida C200
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this machine. This was easy to set up and counted out the coins fast. That is very important to use good quality coin sleeves that are preformed round. Outside of having the bank do this for you, this is the best system I have found to efficiently and accurately wrap coins. It is much better than the automatic machines at grocery stores. Not only do they keep a percentage of the money, I would not be surprised if they miscount in their favor. I give 5 stars to Cassida C200.
customer_reviews.author: GRACE W.

customer_reviews.title: Great coin sorter
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of change that I had saved for over a year and I decided to put that money in the bank. I thought about going to a store and cashing in with a Coin star machine but when I found out that they wanted 11.9% of my money. I used to be able to go to my bank free of charge but now they also charge.so I decided it was time to buy my own coin counting/ sorting/wrapping machine and reap all of my money. After researching various machines I found the Cassida C200 was the best. It's a great machine i am so glad that i purchases this machine has really came in handy.
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: We have been saving coins for quite awhile now and purchased this product to help us wrap them and we are really glad we did. Product is sturdy and dependable and makes a long boring chore easy to manage. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It only worked for about 2 minutes and broke immediately. Total waste of money. I returned it and got my money back. I could not even get what money was left in the machine out of the reservoir. Instead of counting my money it took my money.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Stilley

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Dream!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Royal Sovereign sorter that did not work properly, and I am so glad I did. It sorted a large jar of coins, nearly $300, mostly pennies, without hitch. The plastic is nice and sturdy, unlike the RS. It is simple to operate and easy to load. The RS had a little raised thing inside the bottom of each coin holder, so the wrappers had to fit around it to work. It was hard to get them to fit just right. This one has flat bottoms inside the coin holders, so the wrappers go inside easily and smoothly. This one cost more but is worth every extra penny.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Poor Longevity
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these units in the last 1.5 years. The first failed after 1 year and the second after just 5 months, very disappointing for a $200 purchase. They get used once a day to count the change in the cash drawer before getting deposited. They work great till they break... Kind of a necessary evil. On average the units were counting about $25.00 a day, not very much. Needless to say the longevity of these things is very disappointing. I'm going to contact the company about a replacement. I've heard they’re really difficult and expensive to work with tho.
customer_reviews.author: Godhammer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use Product
customer_reviews.text: Counter is fast and efficient. However the dollar coin slot was marked for pennies and the penny slot was marked for dollars. I switched the tubes and the dollars are falling properly but the penny slot has a defect. It is better than any other method to count coins. I like the fact that it displays the amount of each denomination both by count and by dollars.
customer_reviews.author: WILLA DOUGLAS

customer_reviews.title: box looks like it was already opened
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work out of the box as it had no power. I also have not been refunded 4 days after they received return. ***update*** After posting my negative review I received my refund. Changing from 1 star to 3 star.
customer_reviews.author: Dolorous Edd

customer_reviews.title: Counts accurately
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate. never jammed. solid machine and well worth the money over the cheaper machines. They don't work. This is the entry level machine that does the job, trust me. I tried the others.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Nice coin counter/separator
customer_reviews.text: I really like this machine. Pros: Does a great job separating coins (which is what I use it for mostly). Cons: Not always accurate in the roll feature. Jams in the coin tubes more than I think it should. I have found it does not always count the proper number of coins for a roll (sometimes it is one under or one over).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I was leery about spending so much on a coin counter, but this one is great. It counted my jar full of coins and then I also used the batch feature to roll the coins. Fun and functional. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GOOD FOR COUNTING COINS
customer_reviews.text: If you only need the make a general count of coins into the "hoppers" , this a great machine. However if if want to count them into rolls , the coins sometimes spit out all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Andrews

customer_reviews.title: So easy!
customer_reviews.text: Used it to sort change from vending machines makes it so much easier and love that it keeps count for you! (Sorry did a small amount because first video was too long lol)
customer_reviews.author: Thy

customer_reviews.title: it's  accurate
customer_reviews.text: Keep level,I put a few dollars in pennies dimes little bit of everything . After it counted them I recounted it was right on added a few more recounted perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Much much  easier
customer_reviews.text: This a very good product not perfect but easy to use. I recounted the same amount MULTIPLE times and it was the same amount all the time,it gets a little dirty due to the coins but it seems easy to clean.I wish I had more money to count more, had fun found some Canadian coins that made it in.
customer_reviews.author: J81

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good. 🤞🏼
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had it for a few days... so far, so good. count seems to be accurate and haven’t had any coins jam. i dont have a lot of experience with coin sorters, but it seems pretty fast. i also like that it tallies everything [number of coins, total for each denomination, and grand total]. i dont really have a need for a printer, but the option is nice. it be cool if it could work with any printer... or better yet, wirelessly. Also, love the handle... it’s the little things. anyhow, happy customer here.
customer_reviews.author: Kokoro d.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: When my bank discontinued accepting loose coins, I had to find a sorter/counter for the money from our employee's snack and drink machine. I had tried a much less expensive counter but found it to be very inaccurate when using the coin rollers. I returned it and made this purchase and I'm extremely pleased with it. It comes with sorting trays as well as the coin tubes for pre-formed coin wrappers. I was able to roll nearly a $1000 in coins in just about an hour. Try that by hand!! I would recommend this machine for any small business that may need to sort or roll their coins
customer_reviews.author: Billy B.

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable. Miscounts here and there so if you need it to be exact, then it’s probably not good enough. But if you’re ok with an occasional coin being missed then it’s excellent
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: I gave up
customer_reviews.text: It clogged constantly. I took it apart and cleaned it according to instructions. Still clogged and of course have to take it apart (3 screws) to get the coins back out. Threw it in the trash. Can find a decent coin counter under 700.00 that works!
customer_reviews.author: sharon kent

customer_reviews.title: Worth extra cost. If you buy cheap you will buy again !
customer_reviews.text: Been looking to buy a coin counter/sorter for a while; after reading reviews of this and other products I chose to spend more for a better quality. Just sorted $1,120 worth of coins, over 11,000 pennies ($110.00) with no issuesVery happy with my purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Greg McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use.
customer_reviews.text: The coin counter did its job. It counted and wrapped the coins, made my job easy. Quarters and nickles separated 100%, dines, and pennies not so much, no problem separated them into containers and them into there wrappers. A little longer but not much. It is an excellent machine that works well, and I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Romuald Mioduszewski

customer_reviews.title: Great coin counter for any family
customer_reviews.text: The Cassida 200 is an awesome machine for sorting and wrapping coins. I have collected coins for quite some time and after purchasing this machine, the coins were sorted within the hour. I would recommend this sorter for any family!
customer_reviews.author: Erika C

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, did everything it said it would flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I had never used a machine like this before but was able to sort through over $700 in mixed change and put it in coin wrappers in just over 2 hours which from my perspective is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Coin Sorter
customer_reviews.text: No problems so far. Great coin sorter. Follow the directions for use and you won't have any problems. I recommend getting the Cassida coin Wrappers which work well with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Tensia

customer_reviews.title: Paid for Itself and More in First Use
customer_reviews.text: Everyday we empty our change into an old coffee can or similar and over the past few years --wow, it's added up. So I sprang for this gizmo figuring it would save me time sorting & rolling ... or fees at coinstar. It did! The thing worked great. You can put in a good amount of coins at a clip. You'll have to change the paper rolls (purchased separately) often as it processes pretty fast. I didn't rely on the read out to count the total, so I can't evaluate that. But as a sorter & roller, Im very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Fast counting but slow rolling
customer_reviews.text: Not a big fan of trying to roll coins with this but during this country shortage my store has posted signs asking customers to bring in their change. This unit sorts and counts fast. It doesnt take half dollars but other than that it has saved my team countless hours of counting. We resorted to just bagging by denomination.
customer_reviews.author: J. MURRAY

customer_reviews.title: Worked phenomenal until it stopped working after the first hour ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked phenomenal until it stopped working after the first hour of sorting. Returned item and it was replaced promptly. Works grear when it does. Havent unboxed the replacement unit yet.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Time and Money Saver!
customer_reviews.text: Really loved this machine. Saved me a bunch of time and money. I finally decided to empty out the coin bottles and deposit the money however I was dreading the sorting counting aspect of it. Getting the Cassida C200 made the whole process ALOT less tedious and definitely faster than if I was doing it manually. The cost of the machine paid off too since to have done this at a coin star would have cost me a lot more than I paid for the machine It was a win win purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: This is fun work
customer_reviews.text: This machine is terrific!! I bought it for personal use. We use it for family night, you guess which one will fill next. We have not had any issues with this machine at all. The manual was easy to follow, and cleaning Was simple. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Paw

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: This coin counter is great. Work so good keep differnt amounts for the coins. So you know what you have in pennies dimes and nickels and then totals it up definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Yes it's a bit pricey but worth every penny. Sorted a thousand dollars worth of change in no time. Using it to roll the change is very accurate and so fast. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine.  Company NOT reputable!
customer_reviews.text: Promised a $30 gift card. After 8 emails a two voice calls, I finally received it! Promised pro cleaning kit which was an offer included w/the machine. After 8 emails and two voce calls, I have yet to receive the kit. TERRIBLE!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: stevet13

customer_reviews.title: Convient counter for large quantity of coins. Not a fan of wrapping coins, problems with my hands.
customer_reviews.text: I found it much easier to separate the coins into their own denominations when I had a large sum of coins to wrap. If I had a smaller amount it was fine to put change through together. A few jams but other than that it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Great counter for someone with lots of change.
customer_reviews.text: Very good machine. Makes my life a lot easier when trying to sort all my change collected throughout the year. With banks stopping to count change, this was a great investment for me. I can’t see myself going to use a coinstar or other coin counter at the store where they charge 11.9%. Definitely recommend this for anyone who collects lots of change and needs it to be rolled in order to deposit it at the bank. Counted $500 in its first use with little to no issues. A++++
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST COIN SORTER PERIOD!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING! Use it to help count and roll over $300.00 in loose coins per day and so far, it's been 100% accurate. ZERO jams, ZERO mistakes. Doesn't get any better than this. If you are considering a cheaper product that has a few of these issues, take it from me - DON'T DO IT! Tried that, they were crap. Suck it up, save for an extra week or two if needed - get this, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Most cash machines in grocery stores will take 10-13% (read the small print). My husband wrapped $800 in two hours. The system easily sorted coins and made it easy to wrap them as well. The machine is sturdy and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: BDON

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: We are a wholesale business with a retail cash trade. This is a well-made great functioning item for counting our coins when we prove out our cash sales each day. Highly recommend this product at a great price and a small footprint for limited counter space
customer_reviews.author: George R. Sachs

customer_reviews.title: Wow. This works great!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t do many reviews and of course if I do it’s because I wasn’t happy. But this really works great. 30 years of change wrapped up in several hours. I would highly recommend if you have a lot of loose change. If not pass it on to family and friends. It would be a great regift and actually appreciated. If your into that.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bradley

customer_reviews.title: It works awesome! I was like a little kid at Christmas ...
customer_reviews.text: Have wanted one of these for forever. I have a 5 gallon water jug overflowing with change, plus 2 other containers full. After reading the reviews, I decided to go with the Cassida C200. It works awesome! I was like a little kid at Christmas time watching the coin rolls fill up. Would highly recommend !
customer_reviews.author: mrs k

customer_reviews.title: It works great and is a time saver
customer_reviews.text: I researched several coin counting machines and decided upon Cassida. It set up easily and filled up the coin holders quite rapidly. I am very happy with the purchase and recommend it. Joseph Kearney Massapequa Park NY
customer_reviews.author: Jerry K

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: Counts your cones to the pennie. Highly recommended! Know what you have before going to the bank, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Darnell Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: Used this every month or so to count all the change i accumulate. I feed hundreds of dollars at a time and it hasnt jammed or put a coin in the wrong slot. However make sure if you use the coin rollers that the paper rolls are wide open and not cheap small kind because if it doesnt go in then the coins back up and you must stop to clear it and maybe lose track of them since they might scatter.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: IT'S A  GREAT PRODUCT ,  I LOVE IT !
customer_reviews.text: After several years of coin collecting I decided to cash them in which requires a lot of coin counting/wrapping. In order for me to do this effectively and efficiently I needed a good coin counter. I made a good choice purchasing C200 Cassida..It's very easy to use, It's ,accurate and It will save you a lot of time. It's a great machine and a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Paul & Anita Kisucky

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $200!
customer_reviews.text: Paid $200 for this machine 3 days ago and now its at $140. Boxes doesn't fit in well. It jams if you put too much coins so no you can not put all the coins the picture shows!
customer_reviews.author: cristina sales

customer_reviews.title: As described.
customer_reviews.text: As described. Helped a friend count up some of his coins. This unit seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect coin counting wrapper
customer_reviews.text: This machine is perfect for taking large quantities of mismatched coins and wrapping them into perfect rolls. I had a cheapo machine before only to find that I had to add a coin to each wrap because the weight was off. Not with this machine. It is hyper accurate and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Gough

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: I had 12 years worth of change ($5000+) that I I needed to count and bag. Without this unit I would of taken forever. Soooo heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Diabloss

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great coin sorter and roll filler. Took out a lot of time from hand rolling and sorting.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: Processed more than 3K in coins for my organization. I operated this machine for over 10 hours and it never quit. I double checked each tally twice (as foreign coins and small pocket debris can set the coin sorter off, but then they all do this). Super efficient feature is that it keeps count of each coin denomination total separately as well as grand total. Saves time when you are counting coins for 19 classrooms and the amount has to be on the penny!
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

product_meta.title: Cassida C200 Coin Sorter, Counter and Roller
product_meta.description: Style:C200 USD| Pattern:SorterA Complete Solution to Coin Counting. The Cassida C200 is an all-in-one solution for any coin handling need. Easy to use, it counts, adds, batches, and wraps automatically. Easy to use The C200 recognizes individual denominations and sorts them automatically into large bins. No dials and no knowledge of coin dimensions required. Just load the hopper, press start, and walk away. Grand total of all coins is displayed and detailed reports for each denominations are within a button’s reach. Counting, adding, and batching The C200 includes all the counting modes you would expect to find on a Cassida-designed coin sorter. Batch mode counts amounts as low as 1 coin or as high as 500. An easy-to-read LED display shows both number of coins and dollar amount for each denomination, as well as the grand total. One step sorting and wrapping It takes only seconds to exchange the C200’s bins for the included wrapping attachments. One button sets roll batch amounts for all denominations and C200 stops automatically when a wrapper is full, great for fast-paced environments where there is a need to switch between wrapping and bulk sorting. Fast, but quiet The C200 is quiet in operation, even when counting and sorting at 300 coins per minute!
feature_bullets: C200 dispenses coins into coin bins and/or paper coin wrappers, right out of the box
Hopper capacity: 2000 coinsCoin bin capacity: 900 coins
Operating modes: Counting mode, adding mode, and batching mode
